isIgnoreRead

public boolean isIgnoreRead()
Indicates if this cell should be ignored after reading it from the buffer. If ignoreRead is true the cell will not be stored to the current Line object.

Returns:
the ignoreRead

setIgnoreRead

public void setIgnoreRead(boolean ignoreRead)
Parameters:
ignoreRead - Indicates if this cell should be ignored after reading it from the buffer. If ignoreRead is true the cell will not be stored to the current Line object.

makeCell

public Cell makeCell(java.lang.String sValue,
                     ParsingEventListener listener,
                     long nLineNumber)
              throws ParseException
Creates a cell with a parsed value according to the schema specification for this cell. This method does not throw exception of mandatory cell does not exist. Instead it reports an error event and continues.

Parameters:
sValue -
listener -
nLineNumber -
Returns:
A new cell of a type according to the schema specified. Returns null if there is no value.
Throws:
ParseException

makeCell

public Cell makeCell(java.lang.String sValue)
              throws ParseException
Creates a cell with a parsed value according to the schema specification for this cell. Does not check if cell is mandatory!!

Parameters:
sValue -
Returns:
A new cell of a type according to the schema specified. Returns null if there is no value.

isMandatory

public boolean isMandatory()
Indicates if the corresponding cell is mandatory, that is an error will be reported if it does not exist while parsing.

Returns:
true if the cell is mandatory, false otherwise.

setMandatory

public void setMandatory(boolean mandatory)
Parameters:
mandatory - Indicates if the corresponding cell is mandatory, that is an error will be reported if it does not exist while parsing.

getDefaultCell

public Cell getDefaultCell()
Returns:
The default cell. The value of the default cell will be used if input/output is missing.

setDefaultCell

public void setDefaultCell(Cell defaultCell)
Parameters:
defaultCell - The default cell. The value of the default cell will be used if input/output is missing. The name of the cell has no importance, it will not be used.

setDefaultValue

public void setDefaultValue(java.lang.String sDefaultValue)
                     throws ParseException
Sets the default value as a string. The default value have to be parsable according to the schema format. As long as it is parsable, it will be used exactly as is even though it might not look the same as if it was formatted from a value.

Parameters:
sDefaultValue - The default value formatted according to this schema. Will be used if input/output is missing for this cell.
Throws:
ParseException

getDefaultValue

public java.lang.String getDefaultValue()
Returns:
The default value formatted according to this schema. Will be used if input/output is missing.

format

public java.lang.String format(Cell cell)
Formats a cell to a string according to the rules of this schema.

Parameters:
cell - The cell to format. If this parameter is null or an empty string, the default value will be returned or if there is no default value, an empty string will be returned.
Returns:
The formatted value for this cell.
